title: Serif suggestions?
content:
I'm doing a brand for a financial consultancy, just wondering if anyone has any suggestions for a nice serif I could use for both the logotype and corporate typeface.   
   
cheers.
author: iota

comments.content:
The purpose of the logo is to convey integrity, quality seriousness, and that the company is established.   
   
I'm just after some suggestions of really nice serif faces that I could use. I have a few in mind but I may have overlooked certain faces, or there may be some I'm not aware of.

I'm a big fan of Monotype Ehrhardt. Strong, confident, lots of character:   
   
 [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=202380](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019082644/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=202380)   
   
And check out the Dutch Type Library:   
   
 [http://www.dutchtypelibrary.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019082644/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.com/)

Eldorado comes to mind for some reason. It just has that well-dressed business look. Or perhaps it would work better on a designer suit label...   
   
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font\_frames.tpl?cart=10875742215401785&fontname=Eldorado](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019082644/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=10875742215401785&fontname=Eldorado)
